intro: Parodia maassii var. rubrispina, commonly known as the red-spined cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to South America. It features a short, thick stem with dense, spiny areoles that give it its distinctive appearance. The spines are typically reddish in color, which is a key identifying characteristic of this variety. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its spiny form. This plant is well-suited for arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
